oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-07-17 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-07-17 part 2. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Bern Bennett, starring Sam ""The Man"" Taylor and his orchestra, and featuring the Valentines, the Moonglows, and the Drifters. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Moonglows; Valentines; Sam "The Man" Taylor; Big Al Sears; Haywood Henry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Alan Freed introduces the Moonglows -- Whistle My Love (Moonglows) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces the Valentines -- Lily Maebelle (Valentines) -- Alan Freed introduces the Valentines -- The Woo Woo Train (Valentines) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces Sam ""The Man"" Taylor, Big Al Sears, and Haywood Henry -- The Pretzel (Sam ""The Man"" Taylor, Big Al Sears, Haywood Henry) -- Closing statement (Alan Freed) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Bern Bennett) -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Bennett, Bern, 1921-2014; Taylor, Sam; Drifters (Musical group); Moonglows (Musical group); Valentines (Musical group); Sears, Al, 1910-1990; Henry, Haywood; Melamed, Louis
